wikipedia_page.main: Andrew Turton (1938 – 13 August 2021) was a British anthropologist who specialised on Thailand and the Tai peoples of Southeast Asia.

response: *Turton, Andrew. 1991. "Invulnerability and local knowledge." In Thai Constructions of Knowledge, ed. Manas Chitkasem and Andrew Turton. London: SOAS.

* "The Others Within: Travel and Ethno-spatial Differentiation of Siamese Subjects, 1885–1910", lead article in Civility and Savagery: Social Identity in Tai States, ed. Andrew Turton, London: Curzon Press, 2000: 38–62.
